title: Kids Learning App – Maths, Science & History with Telugu/Hindi/English Support

requirements.text: Apply a vibrant, kid-friendly color palette throughout the entire app using bright, high-contrast colors (e.g., sunshine yellow, grass green, sky blue, coral, tangerine) with rounded shapes, large playful fonts (Fredoka One, Nunito), and oversized touch targets appropriate for ages 3–12. Remove any muted or adult-oriented color tones.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages use the bright kid-friendly color palette from tailwind.config.js (sunshine, grass, sky, coral, tangerine, cherry, lavender, mint scales)
No muted grays or dark corporate tones used as primary UI colors
Fonts are large, rounded, and legible for young children
Buttons and interactive elements have large, finger-friendly touch targets

requirements.text: Restrict age group selection to only 3–12 years old (remove any age groups outside this range such as toddlers under 3 or teens over 12). Update AgeGroupSelection.tsx to show only age-appropriate tiers within 3–12 (e.g., 3–5, 6–8, 9–12).
acceptanceCriteria: AgeGroupSelection page shows only age groups within the 3–12 range
No age group below 3 or above 12 is selectable
Age group cards use kid-friendly labels and illustrations

requirements.text: Expand the Maths section to include: (a) number recognition cards for numbers 1–100 in Telugu, Hindi, and English; (b) interactive counting activities; and (c) basic addition exercises (single-digit and double-digit) with visual aids (e.g., fruit/animal icons). All content must be displayed in the currently selected language.

quotes: add more Number, words in Telugu,,Hindi and English

acceptanceCriteria: Number cards 1–100 are displayed with the numeral and word in the selected language (Telugu, Hindi, or English)
A counting activity lets kids tap objects to count them
Addition exercises show two numbers with visual icons and ask kids to find the sum
Language switch updates all Maths content immediately

requirements.text: Build a Science section with three sub-sections: (a) Body Parts — illustrated human body diagram with labelled parts in Telugu, Hindi, and English; (b) Animals — flashcard-style cards showing animal images with names in all three languages; (c) Plants — flashcard-style cards showing common plants/flowers with names in all three languages. Each card should include a text-to-speech button.

quotes: add more Number, words in Telugu,,Hindi and English

acceptanceCriteria: Science section has three clearly labelled sub-sections: Body Parts, Animals, Plants
Body parts page shows an illustrated body with at least 10 labelled parts in the selected language
Animals page shows at least 15 animal cards with name in selected language
Plants page shows at least 10 plant/flower cards with name in selected language
Each card has a speak button that pronounces the word in the selected language
Language switch updates all labels immediately

requirements.text: Build a History section featuring an interactive map of India. Display all 28 states and 8 union territories with their names and capitals in Telugu, Hindi, and English. Each state should be tappable to show a detail card with the state name, capital, and a relevant emoji or icon. Language switch must update all state names and capitals.

quotes: add more Number, words in Telugu,,Hindi and English

acceptanceCriteria: History section has an India map page listing all 28 states and 8 union territories
Each state entry shows name and capital in the selected language (Telugu, Hindi, English)
Tapping a state reveals a detail card with name, capital, and emoji
Language switch updates all state and capital names
Content is sourced from updated languageData.ts or equivalent data file

requirements.text: Add a persistent language switcher (Telugu / Hindi / English) accessible from the app header and/or subject pages. Remove Tamil as a selectable language option since only Telugu, Hindi, and English are required. Persist the selected language in sessionStorage via the existing useLanguageState hook.

quotes: Telugu, Hindi, English — should kids be able to switch between languages

acceptanceCriteria: Language switcher shows exactly three options: Telugu, Hindi, English
Tamil is removed from all language selection UI
Selected language persists across page navigation within the session
All content pages (Maths, Science, History, Numbers, Alphabet) respond to language change

requirements.text: Update the SubjectSelection page to show exactly three primary subjects: Maths, Science, and History, each with its own dedicated section and appropriate kid-friendly icon/illustration. Each subject card should navigate to its own sub-section page. Remove or demote subjects not part of this core set from the primary grid.

quotes: Maths, Science, History — should each subject have its own section

acceptanceCriteria: SubjectSelection page prominently shows Maths, Science, and History as the three main subjects
Each subject card has a distinct color, icon, and label
Tapping a subject navigates to the correct subject section
Subject sections are clearly separated and not mixed together

requirements.text: Expand languageData.ts to include Telugu and Hindi translations for: numbers 1–100 (words), body part names (at least 10), animal names (at least 15), plant/flower names (at least 10), and all Indian state names and capitals. English entries must also be complete for all these categories.

quotes: add more Number, words in Telugu,,Hindi and English

acceptanceCriteria: languageData.ts exports number words 1–100 in English, Telugu, and Hindi
Body part translations exist in all three languages for at least 10 parts
Animal name translations exist in all three languages for at least 15 animals
Plant name translations exist in all three languages for at least 10 plants
All Indian state and capital names are available in English, Telugu, and Hindi

constraints: Only support Telugu, Hindi, and English — do not add or retain Tamil as a language option
Age group must be restricted to 3–12 years only
All three subjects (Maths, Science, History) must have their own dedicated section
Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: No age groups below 3 or above 12
No mixing of subjects into a single activity pool
No external map API or geolocation features — use static India map data only
No real-time features or multiplayer games
No authentication changes beyond existing Internet Identity setup

Cheerful cartoon India map outline illustration with state boundary lines, bright colors, flat style for kids (india-map-kids.dim_800x900.png)
Bright kids science subject card illustration with microscope, leaf, and animal icons on colorful background (science-subject-card.dim_400x300.png)
Bright kids maths subject card illustration with numbers, plus signs, and colorful blocks (maths-subject-card.dim_400x300.png)
